docs.abstract: A “beloved cookbook destination” loses its lease. A start-up that claims better search technology for real estate agents raises $6 million. Is celebrity-branded marijuana coming?
docs.snippet: A “beloved cookbook destination” loses its lease. A start-up that claims better search technology for real estate agents raises $6 million. Is celebrity-branded marijuana coming?

docs.lead_paragraph: Home Depot's third-quarter profit rose 14 percent as comparable-store sales climbed in the U.S., suggesting that a huge data breach announced exactly two months ago has not shaken the faith of its customers.

headline.main: Home Depot Tops Street; Breach Costs Still Hazy
headline.print_headline: Home Depot Tops Street; Breach Costs Still Hazy

docs.lead_paragraph: The careless remarks of an economist about the Affordable Care Act were an insult to Americans and were largely wrong.
docs.abstract: Editorial criticizes comments, both offensive and largely wrong, by health care reform advocate Jonathan Gruber; notes he stated in recently-surfaced video that the Affordable Care Act relied on a lack of transparency and the stupidity of the American voter to pass; argues comments can only harm the cause of reform, and should not be taken as evidence that the law was hatched in secrecy and foisted on the public by trickery.
docs.snippet: The careless remarks of an economist about the Affordable Care Act were an insult to Americans and were largely wrong.

docs.lead_paragraph: Antagonism over profits and regulation has given way to rising revenue for an industry, and legal and logistical support for the administration.

headline.main: Health Care Law Recasts Insurers as Obama Allies
headline.print_headline: Health Care Law Recasts Insurers as Obama Allies

docs.abstract: Relationship between Obama administration and health insurers, since Affordable Care Act was enacted in 2010, has evolved into symbiotic partnership that is boon to nation's largest private health plans and has led to profitable surge in their Medicaid enrollment; insurers, in turn, have provided crucial support to Pres Obama in court battles over the law.
docs.snippet: Antagonism over profits and regulation has given way to rising revenue for an industry, and legal and logistical support for the administration.

headline.print_headline: Childhood: Obesity Is Tied to Pollutants

docs.abstract: Exposure to secondhand smoke and roadway traffic may be tied to increased body mass index in children and adolescents, a new study suggests.
docs.snippet: Exposure to secondhand smoke and roadway traffic may be tied to increased body mass index in children and adolescents, a new study suggests.

docs.lead_paragraph: A federal appeals court on Monday rejected Maine's effort to trim some young people from its Medicaid rolls, saying the move would violate the Affordable Care Act.

headline.main: U.S. Court Rejects Maine's Effort to Trim Medicaid Rolls
headline.print_headline: U.S. Court Rejects Maine's Effort to Trim Medicaid Rolls
